description:
So ordered for the first time. Right on time delivery. My bro housemate way passed out on the stoop. Delivery guy helped me carry a 6'5, 250lbs to his bedroom. Without question, and concerned. 
This is why I love SF. 
The food was awesome too.
author: Fabian F.

description:
We were pleasantly surprised considering the not so great reviews. 

We both really liked the chasu ramen. I didn't think they were stingy with the chasu like mentioned in a prior post. There were four big pieces of chasu and quite well prepared and juicy. 


Food 9/10

Service 8/10

Atmosphere 8/10

Presentation 8/10
author: Danika Z.

description:
3 stars for customer service. Point blank, it sucks. The asian gal who worked the day shift during lunch is very rude. A smile can go a long way.

Sushi is THE BEST though. Highly recommend
author: Taylor E.

description:
We ordered a teriyaki salmon bento box, Sunomono Cucumber, and Lion King Roll from DJ Sushi.

My friend said the Lion King Roll was really good, so that's why this is a 2-Star rating instead of 1-Star. She said her Sunomono was really bad and tasted weird.

The piece of salmon in my bento box was slightly bigger than the soy sauce packet see photo for reference.

We are currently sitting in the hotel hungry and planning to go out to get food.
author: Reginice C.

description:
I was craving sushi after an extremely long flight from the East Coast, but due to delays I didn't get into SF until close to 11p. There weren't that many places open for delivery so late, so I was delighted that DJ Sushi could accommodate me!

Unfortunately, I wasn't excited by what I got: the edamame was a bit hard and had no salt. The wakame salad was a bit slimy. The miso soup was cold. The hand rolls (I got the cucumber, avocado, and avocado with cream cheese) were just three bites of mostly rice. 

I don't know if this was because it was one of their last orders of the night or if this is how it normally is, but I can't say I'd order from here again (though, again, I'm super duper appreciative that they could take care of my post travel late night dinner needs!).
author: Steff D.

description:
Came here because we had a craving for ramen and some sushi.
  This place is small BUT food was good at a reasonable price.
author: Stanley O.

description: Omg. This place was AMAZING!! Great music, fantastic food!!!. Weird to say but most delicious house green salad of all time. They have perfected salad texture for sure. And the dressing was something I want in my fridge at all times!!.  I cannot forget to mention I had to Tan tan Ramen. AMAZING!! Great job guys!!
author: Anthony M.

description:
1hour and 50minutes for delivery.

It was practically time for the next meal by the time this one came.

We have been disappointed multiple times by the absolutely terrible delivery service from these guys.  Maybe its ok in their restaurant... but whatever you do, don't use them for delivery.  (they should just terminate doing deliveries... that is how bad they are.)
author: Dan O.

description:
Met my boyfriend here for lunch since it's about half way between our offices. He had been before and said it was pretty good ramen.

Ambiance: I am guessing they call it DJ because they were playing EDM style music the whole time- kind of cool. The inside is pretty small, only about 6 tables or so.

Service: Really great service here. Our server was really nice and helped me find a vegetarian ramen to have. She checked in on us a lot and was quick to bring us what we needed.

Food: I got the tempura ramen with vegetarian broth. It was just OK. The noodles were all stuck together in one big clump, and the flavor was pretty bland but it wasn't horrible. My boyfriend got the ramen with meat in it and also said his was very bland. I loved the mushrooms in mine! I've never seen that type of mushroom before.

Would be willing to try the sushi here, but I like other ramen spots downtown more.
author: Hayley D.

description: Great food and nice vibe!! We ordered Bento box and ramen, both pretty tasty! Chicken skewer is also great for a little snack.
author: Yuhan Z.

description: The Ramen here was so good. I like the thin noodles coz usually the noodles that I had were thick. It was new for me so I liked it. The server here was accommodating as well and usually checked on me if I have anything that I need.
author: Eunice F.

description: Food was really good.  Nice and fresh, and the ramen was amazing.  First time having real ramen and I really enjoyed it.
author: Nolena A.

description: If it's chilly outside and you're sitting in the middle you're going to get a cold draft. Pretty cool if you check in Facebook or yelp then they give you option of free edamame, soda, miso soup. The Ramen was okay, noodles were very stuck together so making it difficult to pickup a few noodles. It was more of picking up a ball. U2 roll was delish
author: Yana P.

description: Ordered the Lion King Roll through Eat 24, and very pleased with the taste, the portion, and the price.
author: Zaynub N.

description:
This place has become one of our favorite sushi spits. It's cheap, it's fast, it's conveniently located, and the food is pretty damn good. 

The inside is nothing fancy. They only have 5 tables in the whole restaurant. But, the fast and friendly service makes up for the cramped vibe you may get while dining here.

My go-to is the curashi Dan sashimi combo, 17$. It is 12-15 slices of sashimi (depending on what fresh fish the chef's have available, and how thick the chef slices the fish), atop a bed of sushi rice with a side if seaweed salad and a cup of miso soup! My boyfriend and I have had several of the rolls on their menu, all if which have been pretty good. Their hand rolls (Maki) are an amazing value - usually 5-7$ and it's just as much fish as the regular rolls, just a little harder to eat. 

The sake menu here is pretty great too - most of their sake bottles are between 10-15$ and you'll get 12-16 shots out of it! Their happy hour is okay - nothing special... But their wine is a little cheaper and there are a few appetizers included. 

We will continue to eat here when we are craving sushi in North beach!
author: Taylor D.

description:
My friend and I decided to eat sushi for dinner. I ordered the Bento Box ($12) with an Avocado/Cucumber Roll (6 pieces) and Veggie Tempura (5 pieces). I also checked in and got free edamame. Edamame was originally $4.50. My friend ordered the Sushi Combo F ($16.50).

I thought the edamame was really good. The size was pretty decent even though we got it for free by checking into Yelp. Even if it was $4.50, it would have been a really good deal. It was warm and soft enough to bite into it. The miso soup that came with my order was warm as well. My bento box was good and large. The tempura was very crunchy and consisted of yam (3 pieces), broccoli, and a carrot piece. 

My friend was able to ask for extra wasabi for free. 

The waiter checked in with us and asked if our food was good. 

I will say that both of our meals were a little bit on the expensive side. 

The place can be a little loud. We sat next to a TV and it was showing something violent that was on TNT. There was one man who was pulling another man's intestines out and he was screaming. It was very gross and I tried not to look at the screen. Other than that, the overall experience was good.

Note: There is a minimum $10 credit card charge and you can only use a maximum of 2 credit cards per table.
author: Kristina M.

description: Mediocre overall. Service especially had room for improvement. Started out with takoyaki, which was mostly breading and cold in the middle. Not sure if it was the frozen kind, but felt like it. Ramen itself was pretty good, but nothing spectacular. High note was definitely the chasu. Really tender and melt in your mouth.
author: David L.

description: Had the smallest portion of sashimi combo ever. Not sure if this is the norm at this restaurant?
author: No L.

description:
Sushi was okay, but the services was not great.

Update: My biggest issue is that after calling them back to try and rectify the issue, they essentially blew me off pointing the finger at the delivery company.  No resolution, no ownership for the issue ... disappointing.
author: Tony P.

description:
It's really bad
Like really bad, I really don't know how to tell how bad is it

Saba was smelly
Uni was the worst

The price was unreasonable for that quality
author: Yokyok N.

description:
Ordered from UberEats from these guys since they had a decent rating on there. What should have been a 20-30 minute total wait time turned into over an hour of waiting. Ughh. I ordered my food at 9:18 and got it ~10:30 PM.

The mackerel was okay, but everything else was so meh. The ika/squid was a huge let down since it was that "squid salad" that you would find packaged, not an actual piece of squid. Would not order again due to all the wait and food being not what I expected. :\
author: Aya Z.

description: Jenn is super nice and super cool! The rose are awesome made very nicely and very tasty. Five star for staff & service also for food.
author: Michele T.

description: Food was great, we tried Japanese beef Ramen and the two spoon uni as well as the rainbow roll all three were extremely good we ordered the ramen second to highest spicy level and it was really good at that level if you can handle spice. Only reason I give it 4 stars is because of the fact that we were the only two people eating inside the restaurant and service was ridiculously slow they had only one girl manning tables and to-go orders and they were slammed with to-go orders it seemed like she was more concerned with those than being attentive with us but we got our food pretty quickly and it was good so I might comeback if we're ever here again.
author: Jensun M.

description: We got the unagi over rice dinner entre and what came was a disappointing 8 thin as s pieces of unagi and bunch of other junk. Got here cold as well.  This is the worst. Food trucks have better food.
author: Ben L.

description:
The food was good, but no matter how nice and fast with our order we tried to be, the waitress couldn't spare one smile and gave hardly and eye contact, as a former waitress myself, you can't expect tips if you treat customers like just another thing to bother her.
The toilet has a trap inside, and it like a bus does, it hardly flushes and stuff comes out, disgusting
author: Veronica L.

description:
My partner and ordered in here one night. This place had sub-par sushi -- not good, but not bad. 

We ordered a few of the basic rolls like Alaska Roll (probably the best thing we got but again, it was basic). We also ordered a few specialty rolls like the Lion King Roll (which was our 2nd fave). However, the Spicy Tuna roll was not good at all. Quite dry and fell apart. Also didn't have that much flavor so it ended up tasting like slightly spicy tuna flavored rice and seaweed. 

Stick to the basics here, if anything at all.
author: Grace A.

description: Came here with my coworkers, can't say I was thrilled about this place. Took a long time for the food to come out and sushi wasn't all that great, Ramen was good. Not sure if I'd come back again anytime soon, if I do would only be for the Ramen.
author: Roman L.

description: I don't know why people are rating this place to be 2-3 stars. My husband, our friend, and I came here around 7PM. Yes, the parking is terrible, but that has nothing to do with the store. The attendants are very polite. They're very cordial. Very patient. Not to mention the food came out on time. Yes, they won't come out at the same time because preparation time for certain foods is different. I'm super pleased that for a sushi place, it doesn't smell fishy at all. In addition to that, great quiet atmosphere.
author: Brijhe C.

description: Probabaly a bad idea to order delivery when I was in San Francisco, given all the options. Being under the weather I just wanted soup of some sort. This place had decent reviews. The ramen was not very flavorful. It was cold by the time I got it (which I can't really blame them) but it did affect the taste. The gyoza were good. Next time I might just walk somewhere.
author: Jose F.

description:
I don't think this place deserves all those 1 and 2 star ratings at all! DJ definitely wasn't the most phenomenal sushi, but it was just fine. The service was also decent. 

I got the chashu ramen and my boyfriend got the tonkatsu ramen (both $10), which were both tasty and filling. I particularly thought the chashu was really well cooked and yummy. We also got the 49er roll ($11.50), which was on the small side but still delicious. 

I would definitely check it out if you're craving Japanese and are in the area. 

We used a discount from restaurant.com
author: Emma W.

description: Surprisingly this sushi spot has great rolls and fresh fish! I would not recommend the wine here as they only have box wine! They have siracha and jalapeños on top of my spicy hamachi roll which makes me a happy camper! Especially for the price, you cannot beat it. Some of the fancier rolls are fantastic as well! I am always very impressed with the quality of fish and the staff is super sweet!
author: Ellie J.

description: My brother and I came in on a saturday for dinner. The second I opened the door all I could smell was CHLORINE. We were the only customers in the restaurant. The server was very attentive since we were the only ones. The food honestly was MEH. No presentations and water tasted like chlorine. My sushi rolls looked really ugly and my brother's tempura roll looked a little better than mine. Will I come back? Probably not.
author: Yi K.

description: Horrible service, very bad portions for the price you pay. Waitress refused to help us when she found out I had a Groupon
author: Lisa H.

description:
My heart extends out to mom and pop establishments where the people who own the restaurant are the ones cooking in the kitchen, busting the tables, and taking the orders. This is one of those establishments. 

The veggie tempura ramen I had was absolutely delectable--reminds me almost of the famous Ippudo in NYC. All the ramens have the option of spicy or not spicy, which is right up my alleyway since the spicier the better.  My mom typically prefers udon, but since this place only offers ramen noodles, she opted for that instead. She was definitely not disappointed as she was raving about about the grilled chicken ramen the entire time! 

We were both very dehydrated after the meal though. The MSG level was probably off the charts, but treat yoself to a savory delight every once in a while. A little monosodium glutamate never killed nobody, (I hope.) 

Tip: If you're using the groupon, the combos aren't valid with it. (There is a combo option where if you order a ramen ($10-$11 per bowl), you can order gyoza, or California rolls, or any other small dish for $3.95.)
author: Briana Z.

description: Ordered for takeout. The Albacore Tataki was really flavorful and delicious however the Chicken Ramen Soup was fairly bland and the chicken was chewy (bleh). I'd try this place again for the sushi but would definitely pass on the ramen.
author: Marisa R.

description:
(d.b.a. Mura on Doordash)

Very poor value relative to other sushi/ramen places in SF. Rolls are tiny. Extreme skimping on ramen toppings - I got 3.5 sad slices of pork belly and half an egg. The noodles tasted no better than Maruchan instant.

Gyoza and teriyaki weren't much to write home about either.
author: Barack O.

description:
Came in on Sunday night and the place was pretty empty.  We ordered chasu ramen and sushi combo F or G with a large hot sake.

First the water tasted like soap.  Then we checked in on yelp to get the free edamame (miso soup or soda was the other options) which we never got. Ramen noodles were tough (different from al dente).  Sushi were on the small side especially for $17.50.  I'm glad I didn't get omakase, I would have been much more disappointed.  Rice on the sushi was not consistent and no good.  I bit into some hard rice kernels that may have been from the bottom of the pot, not sure.  All I know for sure is I'm never coming back.  Happy hour was all day Sunday and even at the happy hour prices, this place is not worth your hard earned money.  

Bad service and food.
author: Naty D.

description:
The former Mura although nothing has changed about the space apart from the name. Decent enough ramen but odd service and business decisions distract. 

I like the pork belly ramen. Perhaps a tad salty but I enjoy it nonetheless. Pretty generous toppings for a $10 bowl and the noodles have a decent bite to them. My issue here is that they leave the front door open which on a really cold SF night, makes the ramen lukewarm-tepid the moment it arrives at the table. I guess they keep the door open to let folks know they are open but it takes away from the ramen. You really want the bowl of noodles to arrive pipping hot. The one server was doing her best but obviously overwhelmed. 

More of a place for subsistence eating, pop by if you're looking for a cheap ramen fix but definitely not a destination spot by any means.
author: Jon L.

description:
Too cheap to give me a side of unagi sauce (eel sauce) on both occasions. I ordered 2 sushi rolls on both occasions, so 16 pieces of sushi, and I requested 2 sides of unagi sauce because I know that the container that they put the sauce in is really tiny, and they give me about 2 drops of sauce in ONE container for 16 pieces of sushi which was only enough sauce for ONE piece of sushi, so I spent $40 on dry sushi on both occasions because they are too cheap to give me what I asked for. 
Is pre-made unagi sauce that expensive that I can't get any? You wouldn't eat a dry hot dog without ketchup, would you? 
There are hundreds of sushi restaurants in San Francisco. I'll go to the proper ones that are run by people with brains. Such a shame that a business loses repeat local customers over 3 cents. It was a delivery order both times, so I couldn't request additional sauce.
author: Keagan G.

description: Very tasty sushi and nice ambiance.  I wish the prices were a bit cheaper though.
author: Mason W.

description:
What are you doing in this neighborhood? Huh?? Oh, your an evangelist going around passing the 10 commandments out to the guys in the neighborhood looking to go to the girlie clubs, huh? Now you need to eat yourself.

Well, this place is a good bet. Your not going to have to go into confession by entering this establishment. This is a top notch Sushi bar. Once you walk in you will know it isn't the cookie cutter chain you are so tired of going to. 

Outside the signage is hidden as if it were a speakeasy. Then once you enter there is an entry hall that creates a private, comfortable setting. As you enter more inside you get to a raised dining area on your left. Its all very cozy. Very comfortable. Kitchen to the right sort of covered up with workers exiting and entering frequently. To the rear more seating. 

Above is a unique ceiling with visual interest from special lighting and different depths. Service is efficient/friendly and food is a good value.
author: Stefan T.

description: This restaurant is named under "Mura Ramen" in Doordash.  If we have known this, we would NOT order from them.  We had a very negative experience with their food and service in the past.  Today, another negative experience.  We received the food and most of the 3 orders of ramen broth ended up out of their containers and in the bag.  This created a big mess, and at least one of us does not have lunch.  I called the restaurant to let them know about it and I was told rudely that it is not their problem, it is Doordash problem, then hung up on me.  TERRIBLE CUSTOMER SERVICE.  We could tell that the broth were packaged poorly, and it is not entirely the driver's fault.  If I can give this place ZERO stars I will.   Stay away from this place!!!!!!
author: Foodie S.

description:
I ordered on postmaste and we are disappointed. Overprice for the quality, not the most tasty sushi.

I not recommand this sushi actually.
author: Baptiste D.

description:
Browsing Yelp one afternoon and saw that this place newly opened. Their presentation was what enticed me to come here. This place was hidden in my opinion. Didn't have a very visible sign unless you were across the street. Upon entering, it seemed a little small. Staff was very welcoming.

Food came at a timely manner. Good presentation, cooked nicely. Flavors were there but it didn't make me crave more. If I had to pick my favorite, it would probably be the Lion King Roll. Everything is decent. One thing that bugged me was having to ask 2 different waitresses for a fork. We told them and they said OK, but never came back with a fork. Happened several times. Halfway through our meal, she finally came back. They were nice and apologetic but would have been nice to not wait that long.
author: Benita M.

description: Waited double the estimated delivery time for food, and by the time it arrived, the sushi was too warm and the tonkatsu was not crispy from the steam inside the plastic bento. Everything tasted alright, but was a bit bland, from the salad to the miso soup to the sushi and tonkatsu. Wouldn't recommend for delivery, but maybe in store will be slightly better.
author: Kevin N.

description:
I have pretty high standards for ramen, so a "Meh" (i.e. 2 stars) from me could be an "A-OK" (i.e. 3 stars) for someone else.  That being said, I was disappointed by the entire trinity: broth, noodles and meat.  Since there are a bunch of ramen options downtown, there really is no good reason for sub-par ramen.

Gyoza: Completely deep fried.  I definitely prefer the pan-fried (i.e. potsticker) style since I like the contrast of boiled and fried on the same dumpling.  It wasn't that memorable.

Chashu Ramen: A pork bone broth, but no where near as rich as a traditional tonkotsu.  The noodles were a bit disappointing, a little too al dente; tasted like something from a package you'd get at the supermarket.  The pork belly was cold (despite resting in warm soup) and was pretty dry (despite resting in wet soup).  The half egg was cooked decently though.
author: Adam B.

description: Absolutely delicious and unique sushi. We have lived in the North beach neighborhood for years and it's hard to find good and fresh sushi in the midst of the Italian restaurants and bars scene. We ordered sushi combo B, the classic shrimp tempura roll, and the 49er roll with the standout being the Chicago roll with fresh mango. Everything was spot on! The giant Asahi beers for $6 and white boxed wine (love it!) for $4 was the little cherry on top. No frills, absolutely fresh fish and not crazy SF prices..turn up the beat DJ sushi!
author: Sarah H.

description: Great place to get good ramen at a great price. Friendly staff and food is always hot and fresh. Dining area is relativity small but clean. Menu has a great selection and variety. Sushi portions are relatively small.
author: Jasen M.

description:
Had an assortment of sashimi here which was not NOT fresh. On top of that, they really skimped out on the fish.

Not a place I would recommend to any of my friends. Will not be back (at least not for sushi).
author: Eva Y.

description: It tastes good...BUT the rolls are INCREDIBLY small, and they gave me the wrong one,if not ones....i was the only person there and it took then 20+ minutes to make it...literally....it was supposed to be the amigos roll and the tiger...definitely not the tiger ! Wish i would have looked prior to leaving $27 i should have kept
author: Laufey A.

description: Sooo In love with the tantan Ramen . Definitely will come back. Recommend to everyone
author: Yue G.

description: Excellent sushi and food+decent customer service, tried their fried gyoza and Lion King roll(baked sushi) both really good! Coming back for an other visit! Also check out Groupon for some of their deals!
author: William H.

description:
I stumbled upon this place a couple weeks ago looking for a catering service near the financial district for a party I was planning. This place was close and the name of this restaurant was very striking so i decided to give it a shot. When I called in to ask about their catering services the nice lady who picked up provided me with helpful and detailed information about the different platter options that they offered. I ended up getting the Mix Party Tray, which included a variety of their classic and specialty rolls as well as an assortment of nigiri. When the delivery came, we looked inside and the platters were arranged in a delightful display. All the rolls looked delicious and the fish on the nigiri was really fresh. The food was amazing, we wished we ordered more! Overall, we really enjoyed the catering service that DJ Sushi provided and are definitely going to order from them again soon. 

Tip! Call at least one day in advance for the party trays to allow for preparation!
author: Auden W.

description:
Eat24 order: drop down menu allowed for a 5pm delivery, but received a call 19 minutes prior to the 5pm delivery time stating that the kitchen opens at 5pm, so they would need time to cook and deliver the food. 

Other than being a little late to deliver for a team shindig, the spring rolls, chicken gyoza, and edamame were tasty and in plentiful supply. Delivery person was friendly and fast. Would order again--just be wary of delivery times. If you're catering for a party or something that needs to promptly start at 5pm, call ahead to confirm that they can fulfill the delivery.
author: Alison A.

description: Good chirashi bowl for cheap. And it came with miso and seaweed salad. My feeling when people rate places like this low is that they probably ordered things that are generally horrible everywhere (non traditional ramen, cheap sushi etc) because the good stuff here tastes good
author: Melanie D.

description: i ordered this ramen through doordash, and it looked so good in the bowl! but there was basically no flavor to the broth and noodles. should have asked for some soy sauce! i got the spicy tan tan ramen, it was not spicy at all. luckily, i also got kimchi with it so, i got a bit of flavor. maybe this place isn't known for ramen, but it has it in its name! and i know i ordered it to go, but the noodles came really super congealed. never had a problem with other ramen places before. oh well!
author: Erica F.

description: I've been in the industry for 10 years and would never complain about something unless it was justified. The sushi roll I got was pretty decent, the ramen was not. Noodles were hard and clumped together and the soup was cold. And I love ramen. Kind of a rough ending to my birthday night
author: Nikky L.

description:
I wanted to check out restaurants in the North Beach neighborhood, since I work close by in FiDi. I was craving ramen and yelp pointed me in this direction. The place was a little hard to find at first, since it has no visible street sign. 

Inside, it's quite cozy with a tv in the middle of the room. Good for watching a game with a small group of friends. The sushi roll and ramen were both pretty standard, with the ramen leaning towards being a little salty. Since I came here with a groupon, my word of advice is that the daily special deal cannot be used simultaneously with the groupon offer.
author: Nancy W.

description: Ordered the chicken teriyaki with miso soup through meal pal from this restaurant. I enjoyed the food a lot - the portions were fair and I would definitely come back to try other things.
author: Travis N.

description:
We have been here three times and tonight was the worse and we won't be back.  The combination of inconsistent quality food and mediocre service are the reasons. 

We had 
- the chashu ramen and that's ok. My older daughter liked this 
- the fried chicken ramen and the chicken tasted a bit sour.  I think it's just old.  We are now worried about food poisoning.   We told the waiter to tell the chef.  We didn't expect a refund just a comment as we ate the ramen and left most of the chicken.  He didn't know what to say. 
- dragon roll.  This was pretty good
- Walu nigiri.  Fairly skim on the fish
- hamachi Kama.  First time we had this was great.  This time it was undercooked and we had to ask them to go back and cook it more.  He did apologize but by this time we have lost our good impression of this place

To add on to this, service is lacking.  I had to ask for plates, bowls.  It's a Chinese run Japanese place and the waiter didn't speak much English.  I started to speak to him in mandarin. That helped a little. 

Lastly, we were using a restaurant.com coupon.  We felt a little bit like a second class citizen as soon as he heard this.  

Imagine our whole family felt pretty unsatisfied with the meal and we paid $25 less than full price.  How disappointing.  Was hoping to be a regular here as its 5 blocks from our house.  No more !!
author: Lei H.

description:
Was in SF for a conference, and was forced to order from here as they were close to my hotel & still open/delivering at 9:30pm on a weeknight

Ordered a spicy tuna roll, Philadelphia roll, hamachi roll w/ lime and an order of escolar nigiri.

Took over an hour for delivery.   Strike one.

The spicy tuna was somehow watery?  Obviously the tuna was frozen and improperly defrosted.  The roll was cut unevenly, 6 or so thin pieces and one random large end piece?  Strike two.

Philadelphia roll had a tiny sliver of cream cheese.  I remember the order form prompting an additional $.50 charge for cream cheese although obviously Philly roll requires it.  Who skimps on cream cheese?  Strike three not even swinging on a lob down the middle.

The hamachi roll was basically inedible and the nigiri was a thing that existed.  Anyway we're out already so no point in elaborating.  I guess I deserved it for ordering from a place that serves both sushi and ramen.
author: Pamela B.

description:
Ordered beef ramen, lion king sushi, and gyoza.

The sushi and gyoza were average, nothing to rave about but also nothing to complain about. The ramen, however, makes this place deserve 2 stars. It came with corn, so that's a plus. But the ramen really tasted like top ramen broth or had so much msg! Not sure which one, could be both.
author: Paulina T.

description:
DJ Sushi is not good. The sushi is extremely average, but the portions stand out because they are TINY. The Lion King Roll was about 1/2 the size of others that I've had in the city. 

To give you an idea of the portion size, here is a picture of 3 full rolls of sushi (about $25 worth)... It all fit in one small delicery box...

I would say skip this place and find something with more bang for your buck. If it was this expensive relative to what you get, the quality should be way better.
author: Tanay J.

description: For the price it was great food and excellent delivery on EAT24! Delivery was early, polite and would not take an extra tip!
author: Jim M.

description:
Came here for lunch on a Friday and there was no one except for our table, but the restaurant was super nice. I really liked the decor and the high Japanese like ceiling in the back.

Food:

Fuji Mountain Roll: My coworker got this and it came literally on fire. It was a nice touch and she said it was delicious.

Broadway Roll: I thought this roll was really good too. The flavors were delicious. I liked the sauce on top. The food was fresh. 

It doesn't seem like this restaurant should get such a low rating. Maybe it's just a problem with delivery, but it was decent.
author: Kelly N.

description: OMG if you order delivery from this place be prepared to wait more than an hour and a half for your food to come. I ordered during lunchtime at around 11:50am and my food came at 1:30pm. When I called the restaurant to find out where my order was all the guy said was it's on  the way and hung up on me. Hella rude.. Never ordering delivery from here again
author: Lennie G.

description: This place is awesome for sushi and ramen lovers. First thing the waitress asks you is do you have a coupon. They will then outline all of the deals and promos they have out there. We came with a Groupon. We ordered the Tan Tan ramen, F sushi/ sashimi special, Maguro, Hama toro, Sake toro and Sake sashimi. I'm really picky with my ramen. But DJ's was delicious! You get a lightly spiced ramen with an egg, Chashu, corn and small pieces of beef. All of the sushi and sashimi tasted fresh. We loved the toro because of the fatty flavor. I like how this place has all types of Yelp, Groupon and happy hour specials. I'll be back to try some of their sushi rolls and other ramen flavors.
author: Khoi N.

description:
I'm so happy we found this place! It's a hole in the wall (and the exterior and interior are not very appealing) but the food was awesome! They have an amazing happy hour!!! We had the gyoza, one of the pork ramens and the Giant roll. The gyoza was nothing special but the ramen and the Giant roll were amazing!!!!!

I highly recommend this place for some quick, cheap sushi
author: Julia M.

description:
This is my review for my dinner the other night, Friday, August 25th.
Learned that this was one of the Top 10 Best Sushi Restaurants in San Francisco, which was impressive.  First off, parking is horrendous here.  I suggest getting an Uber/Lyft coming here.
I ordered a Super California Roll and the Spicy Miso Ramen...my ramen took about 10-15 mins to come and the sushi came another 15 mins after that.  Finished my cup of water before the first batch of food came and never got my drink filled again.  Gotta tell you, it was quite the challenge to eat ramen and sushi (dipped in soy sauce & wasabi) without drinking anything! The next time I saw my waitress after serving my food was to hand me the bill.  Not one time did she asked me if I was okay, if I needed anything else, etc.  Paid in cash and the waitress never gave me my change.  Which was cool, I am not gonna make a big deal out of a few dollars, but the decision to tip was taken away from me, and on top of that, upon leaving, the waitress that "helped" me all night never thanked me in some form for my business! 

Ramen was delicious, but the sushi was deep fried to death.
Goes to show you that having the best food in town means absolutely nothing when you have staff that couldn't interact with customers to begin with! I wont necessarily stay away from this place, but I wouldn't jump through hoops and the traffic in the city to come here again. 
2/5 stars is generous in my book, considering the bad service and being dehydrated to an inch of my life after the long walk to my car for water.
author: Chris A.

description: Got a Groupon deal so tried it out. Food is good but not the best, there are so many amazing ramen places around. Lacks flavor but still a satisfying and good meal. Would recommend. They regularly do promos like I saw an offer to do a yelp check in and get a soda, and offers so i would say take advantage and try it, you might like it!
author: Zoe L.

description: Great standard Japanese, love the ramen and for a while was my standard for dinner. Can be busy but staff were always good when I was there. Must have been 50 time and got to know the owner, v nice place. I don't get some of the bad reviews, I always had good food here. Good portions (for Japanese) and fresh.
author: Ryan S.

description: Long wait. Ramen overcooked. Instant ramen noodles taste even better than this place. Place smells like old rotten wood. Not a comfortable atmosphere to dine in.
author: Linh D.

description:
If you eat (relatively) good sushi often, don't order any here. Their rice is far too dense/tough to chew. They also put too much rice in each roll which compounds their bad rice problem.

I can't speak for the ramen, but my review is for the sushi. I believe it was two star quality. Filling but not enjoyable. To be honest, I've bought better sushi at Safeway.
author: Tylor L.

description: This is the second time I've been here and have really liked the sushi I've had here! Quick service and nice employees. Their dragon roll is really good- I recommend it. We also ordered the dynamite and thought it was good!
author: Susannah H.

description:
Ordered delivery, I had the chicken ramen. As someone who usually likes spicy food it was way too spicy and I had asked for mild. 

I also had the tuna poke. It tasted great and the chips they put the poke on is funny but delicious.
author: Mike D.

description: It's not gourmet sushi but it's efficient and great flavor bang for your buck.
author: drew n.

description: Got the pork belly ramen and takoyaki though UberEats. Love the way it was package  (soup in a soup container and the ramen and extras in a takeout plastic container). A bike deliver met me in front of my hotel and the food was still a decent warmth. The broth was super yummy and the batter for the Takoyaki was awesome. Great for anyone on a business trip who wants to stay in for dinner.
author: Ellejah B.

description: My reviews keep going to the "Not Recommended" section. Please read what I had to share in my previous review. Poor service really goes a long way. I certainly hope that the service improves.
author: M. I.

description: I had a pretty awful experience ordering from this place. They took a very long time to deliver, when I called and asked for an update on ETA, it was obvious they forgot to send my order out. When they got here, the driver was pretty rude and yelled at me over tip. Additionally my soup and edamame were cold and my sushi was warm. There were also weird small plastic pieces in my miso soup and bones in the salmon. Bummer to say the least.
author: Anna R.

description: I came in a few times through MealPal orders. I probably wouldn't have found this place otherwise. The service at this restaurant is really subpar. I always wait several minutes before someone shows up to greet me. It is very strange that it is completely empty at noon. Then I wait quite a few minutes for my order which is supposed to be preordered and ready to go. I guess the assumption is the make it fresh when I arrive. But the ramen noodles are completely lumped together as if they have been sitting around for a long time. They r inseparable I just eat them pretty much in that lump. I will never order from this place again
author: Julie T.

description: I had ramen and it was the worst I've ever had it. My friend had a sushi roll and loved it. I guess I was not lucky.
author: Mayara L.

description:
We came with a restaurant.com coupon that's $25 off $50, which made the check easier to stomach and allowed us to try way more food. We ended up getting DJ Roll, Sushi Combo F (5 pieces of sushi +  2 pieces of nigiri), and an avocado roll platter with tempura and salad.  They all met expectations! The price was between $13 - $16 per dish, which is why I'd recommend getting a coupon to come. To reach $50, we bought miso soup and wakame salad (seaweed salad: $4) for appetizers and ended with cookies and cream dessert.

The atmosphere felt very rustic and Asian, and the dim lighting gave it a relaxing ambience. But, get a coupon!
author: Shelley C.

description: I was in town for the weekend and after a while of roaming the town I was looking for some sushi, I heard San Francisco has some great locations so I decided to stop by this one and it did not disappoint! I was promptly seated and sushi was delicious and fresh, also good prices and good location with street parking.
author: Igor G.

description: Love this place , great sushi and the happy hour is fun for sake bombs . The ramen is just as good as the sushi so this place is just great especially because there isn't to many good sushi spots in the area that aren't overly priced
author: Anjelica H.

description: love there~~~~~~~~I have order a lot time delivery from here, and I came here today, they have daily special, only 10$ per roll, that's sound nice, but I am very like the 49er roll.
author: Chenqi Cao J.

description:
Thought the 3-star review is a little low. Ramen was perfectly solid, though there was no one else in the restaurant on a Sunday evening. Good value -- $10 per bowl.

Nothing to write home about but a dependable option if in the neighborhood.
author: Teddy S.

description:
I bought a Groupon voucher which is "$40 Value Toward Food and Drink for Four or More People." Today, I went with two family members to the restaurant. The waitress told me that I cannot use it because I have three people, not four. I explained that the voucher should be treated like cash, for $40 value. However, she still insisted that they would not allow us to use it. What a nonsense thing that I had to deal with. Even after I said that my wife is pregnant that could make us a team of four, she still said the voucher was not going to be honored.

We were so hungry at the time so we decided to give this restaurant a chance by paying cash. However, the food was mediocre. We ordered the Tan Tan ramen, tempura ramen. The ramen was very salty. 

In the nutshell, bad customer services and mediocre food.
author: Anthony B N.

description: This place was relatively decent, but honestly I've had better omakase.  It did it's job, but it didn't stick with me like some other sushi places I've been, especially ones offering chef's choice omakase.  It didn't seem like it was prepared with the kind of care I've seen many sushi chefs show in the past.  Also, they really need to do something about the leaky sink.
author: Judaea K.

description: This is horrible I paid $34 for 24 pieces of sashimi that were half pieces ... Then they tried to tell me on the phone this was a regular order .... It was basically 12 pieces cut in half to make 24!!!! Never again
author: Darlene G.

description: Ordered the salmon Kama special and it took an embarrassing 40 mins to make. It was tasty, but definitely not worth 40 min wait, and there were barely enough scraps of meat on it to justify calling it a meal. Mostly composed of bones and salmon skin with a side of greens and rice.
author: Patrick K.

description: Excellent food ,as I am fun of Japanese food ,i went to Japan many time ,it exactly remind me what I eat while I was in japan .I absolutely recommend it .
author: Fathi R.

description: I'm in North Beach often and I absolutely love going in to Dj Sushi. I love their sushi and Jenny always takes care of us. Everyone their is so kind and work so hard to have a great restaurant. I highly recommend going in, don't listen to all these snobby reviews. Get the double hamachi roll, hot summer, and the dj. So damn good!
author: Allison C.

description: Wow! Oh. Em. Gee! This place is amazing! Grade A Delicious! With a capital Grade A! Service was aight
author: Molly M.

description: Place is small but nice , waitress is nice and people look friendly . Attended us quick and they played great music !
author: Julio A.

description: fire alret! this place is bomb! dynamite role is by far the best! again fire!!! i said firrrrrreeee!!
author: Rolando R.

description: Visited with my girlfriend. She is vegan, I am not, and they had rolls that both of us enjoyed a lot.
author: Paul S.

description: Most places do state that the Groupon can not be applied to Happy Hours. That is until you've spent the value of the certificate on main courses. Then you can by the bar bite, appetizers, and sometimes drinks at the happy hour price. When we asked for the check, the waitress announced that we were not entitled to the happy hour prices, even though we spent well over the certificate value. On top of that, there was a sign on the wall saying if you check-in on FaceBook or Yelp, you can get a free coke, miso soup, or edamame; so we did. Because we had a groupon, we were not entitled to that either. The place is dirty and there's just stuff out on some of the tables like there stocking up and not ready to open. The beef in the Ramen was tough and the sushi was unremarkable and fell apart easily. There was a sign just inside that stated free Wi-Fi, waitress stated there really wasn't I felt scammed all around.
author: John W.

description:
My boyfriend and I ate here for a nice little date night out in the city. We were CRAVING sushi and we wanted to try a place in the city that we have never been before. We walk in and there is absolutely no one in the restaurant. IN MY OPINION, this is never usually a good sign and I should have trusted my instinct. First of all, we were being taken over at our table by FLIES and GNATS. Seriously?! I had to fight these bugs while trying to enjoy my miso soup. Next, I ordered the bento box which was pretty good despite its small size. One thing I should stop doing, is comparing San Francisco food to food that I can get in any other city for a better price and an actual ADULT SIZE. 

My chicken bento box was pretty small and it kinda pissed me off for the money that I spent on it. Next, we ordered about five rolls of sushi that were pretty good. It all came up to $67 in which I could have totally got the same thing somewhere close to home (Fairfield) for waaaay cheaper. Again, seriously? All the while, I'm fighting flies, gnats & ANTS on my table. One fly had the nerve to land it's little ass on my sushi! I was completely done with this place after that! Definitely not worth almost $70!!!
author: Sierra H.

description:
I was surprised I found this restaurant. The food was pretty amazing. I ordered Pink Lady Roll (my wife love this name), Spider Roll, Veggie Tempura Roll, Alaska Roll and 49er Roll.

It was delivered early than I thought. When I saw the box I was wondering why there are only two small boxes. However, when I open the boxes, all five rolls set up perfect. my wife was so excited about Pink Lady Roll. It looks like the pinky heart. "Cutest sushi I have never seen before" that's what she said.

Overall it was nice experience to have food in this restaurant.
author: Adam C.

description: Not worth the price. The fish is not fresh and the roll is way too small to compare to other restaurants I have eaten before. The ramen is ok though.
author: Liying H.

description: Ordered through Amazon Prime Now and the food came very fast (one star for the prompt delivery). Problem is, food was crappy. I ordered sashimi and nigiri. The fish wasn't fresh at all. Seems like it was frozen at one point. Was bleeding into the food tray. Portions were pitifully tiny (especially the nigiri which was a joke). Extremely overpriced for what you get. Won't be back and I hope you don't make the same mistake. Nearly $30 order that left me hungry and dissatisfied. At least I'm enjoying my Diet Coke.
author: Mark K.

description: Came here for late night sushi crave, and they have a lot of selections here. Not just simply fresh sashimi sushi, they do have great GRILL SQUID!!! I'm surprised they serve different small plates and yummy appetizers here, must come here for the grill squid, lamb chops and mussels!! Great pair with sake and cold beers!
author: 锐锋

description: Just ordered delivery! About45 minutes.  Shrimp tempura roll, spicy tuna roll, salmon avocado roll.  All very fresh.  Super reasonably priced. No delivery charge.  Will definitely order again.
author: Shannon J.

description:
Love their sushi!!! Super friendly staff! My favorite roll is the hamachi and lime roll! And their ramen is amazing! Broth is very flavorful! 

:)
author: Jamie F.

description:
I live in the neighborhood and order ramen all the time! So yummy and I have high ramen standards 
Definitely recommend !
author: Malina M.

description: We chose to have sushi & ramen delivered instead of room service, it was delivered earlier than we thought & tasted so good, so happy we found this place, definitely recommended for anyone visiting SF!
author: Ria S.

description: A new restaurant located at Chinatown, foods are good to try. Nice people , good attitude. The garlic spicy Edamame is a must, it taste awesome. Although they don't have too many choice of sashimi, the ones they have are fresh . Especially the seared salmon toro, taste really good. It's good ethic aspect, cuz not much people know about the restaurant for now, they don't order too much fish because they want to ensure customers can eat fresh sashimi. They also have ramen on menu, not bad. Give it a try .
author: becky c.

description: Ordered sushi from here last night and it was terrible.  Barely any fish in the sushi and the Edamame was served cold and it was not cheap.  I was very disappointed.  Ordered spicy tuna roll... cant see barely any tuna just all rice.
author: S G.

description: The ramen was not great at all!! Don't recommend these place!! If you want an appetizer it's an ok place. But for food wise I don't think this is the place the food is spicy but with no flavor in the ramen.
author: Christine M.

description: I came in with a group of friends and we agreed that the broth and service was good, but the temperature of the broth was warm.
author: Mimi B.

description:
its my first time to write a yelp review, and its because this restaurant worth a try, worth your time!
i've ordered chicken skewers, spicy garlic edamame as appetizer. chicken skewers are pair well with my hot sake, spicy garlic edamame is a new try to me, cuz i have never try this special one（usually its the regular one with salt). i actually love this spicy one! 
omakase with daily special nigiri is a great combo for one person, fresh and great taste!
overall, this is a worth trying restaurant, i like it very much and would love to come back with friends.
author: Zubin Z.

description: Ordered via EAT24 delivery through Yelp. Ramen broth arrived luke warm and it was flavorless. Sushi combo was not well made (pieces fell apart) and the rock n roll tasted funny, as if the eel was not fresh. This is mediocre food at best. Look elsewhere.
author: Steven H.

description: We were a little weary coming here after reading some of the reviews having bought a Groupon. I will say though we were thoroughly pleased with our visit. We arrived a few minutes before opening, and so we just walked around the block waiting for them to open. Once the doors were open, we went right in and were seated immediately. We both knew we wanted Ramen so I did the Pork Belly and Hubby did the Tonkatsu - both in spicy. For a chilly day in SF, it was PERFECT. The flavors were rich and intense and all in all - very delicious. We were pleased! Even though we were there during Happy Hour, we were not allowed Happy Hour prices due to the Groupon - no biggie. 2 Ramens ($10 each plus 1 large beer), ended up being about $33 out the door including tax and tip (so $20 on the groupon and $13 on the credit card). Not too bad for SF - plus a bonus they take Discover Card. We'd be back! The groupon sealed the deal :)
author: Vivian P.

description: Mediocre food with low quality fish. They try to charge as much as other high-quality sushi restaurants, so not only is it the food very mediocre, but the price is high as well. Definitely a hard pass on this restaurant.
author: Derrick W.

description:
Ramen was OK, nothing great. Best part was the egg

Bento box was TINY. Thinnest piece of salmon teriyaki ever with the smallest rolls. Thanks for the $12 rice and salad

Service was terrible

DONT COME HERE!!
author: Jessica C.

description: I love the sashimi here. The fish is very fresh!very nice!  I eat the sushi around the Bay Area !most of the fish is not very fresh !
author: Alex Z.

description:
ordered from grub hub - hand rolls were made with rice it was mediocre and SUPER expensive 

find another spot - NEVER AGAIN
author: jennifer t.

description: one of the best sushi l've tried.. Tan tan ramen is delicious, we also ordered hot summer roll and dragon roll, everything was super tasty
author: Maye G.

description: Very over priced for simple rolls. The rolls were pretty much entirely all rice and very little actual fish in them. No soy sauce with delivery either.
author: Nathan C.

description:
I came here on an early afternoon during the week, and the place was empty, but I assumed that was because they had just opened and it was a random Tuesday. The place was set up in a way that I can picture it being cute and intimate in the evening if it were busier, but this was not the case the time I went. 

I was casually greeted as I came in, solo, to grab a quick bite between meetings in the city, and seated at a booth in the back. The menu seemed to have a good number of things on it, and I settled on one of the sushi/sashimi combos (Combo F). I also redeemed a free miso soup by checking in on Yelp. 

Now the most important point of reviews is on the food and unfortunately, it was just OK for me.... the miso soup came out and it was rather bland and watered down, I feel that either there was not enough miso mixed in it, or it was just not seasoned well cause it didn't have the salty savory flavor that I was craving in a miso soup. The combo came out and the roll itself was good with an appropriate ratio of rice to other ingredients. I also thought the fish tasted fresh and was of good quality. However, the sashimi pieces that came with the combo were very thin and small slices. Not like the ones I see in the photos posted by other yelpers. Perhaps there was a new chef training or something, but I left feeling like I missed out on something. *In hindsight, I should have taken photos of what I got, but like the piglet I am, I just scarfed it down the moment it was placed in front of me.

Bottom line: The entire meal was exactly a 3-star "just ok" experience. I'd be interested in coming back again at a more busy time, to see if it is better that that, and if my first trip was a "just opening up and getting started" fluke, but with so many other food options in the area, I guess we'll see if that happens.
author: Jackie D.

description: I ordered their beef teriyaki lunch today via Uber Eat and was so disappointed about the quality of food.  First it took forever for them to prepare the food, that caused a delay in the deliver; then when the food arrived: Sushi was soggy (california roll tasted like paste); the wasabi was bright green in color; Beef teriyaki was super salty and overcooked.  The only decent thing was the miso soup and salad.  They are charging $10 for that. WHAT!
author: Carina N.

description: Today must not be my day for ordering food. This is my second lunch order as the first was a bust from some place else. I ordered the shrimp tempura hand roll (shrimp NOT cooked!), you can see that it's clear and slimy which is not how cooked shrimp should look like! Second I ordered the veggie tempura roll which should have had sweet yam and potato. The veggies in here are orange. I'm assuming it's carrot because it's definitely not soft. It tastes like carrot. Where's the sweet yam and the potato?! Should have known better than to order from a restaurant on Broadway. I may have to stop ordering food from now on. Not cooked shrimp?!? That's outrageous!!
author: Sheena C.

description:
Ordered delivery. Wasn't terrible but also wasn't amazing. I'd probably eat it again but it wasn't anything to write home about. 

Sidenote: It was a bit odd that they gave me a free miss soup with no spoon.
author: Ashley M.

description: Good for delivery at the office. Not the best of sushi and sashimi but good enough for government (and a hungry stomach). Love the freebie rolls if you order more than $50!
author: Ed L.

description: Love this place. Love the vibe n food is awesome!!! Staff is always friendly and accommodating. Happy hour menu is great and they have a huge menu selection. Ramen? Sushi? Bento boxes?! All of the above. If you wanna get a sushi fix in the city... This is the place to go. Great location too. And the prices aren't bad at all!!!!
author: Christian R.

description: Mediocre at best. Ramen was flavorless, egg rolls were soggy and gyoza tasted old. The sushi was mushy and bland. Not a good experience.
author: Brian P.

description: DJ's was doable for nearly 10pm on a weeknight. Sushi tasted very generic, but miso was nice. My friends had the salad with sashimi and enjoyed. Good stop if you're craving sushi late night but if I had the opportunity to go elsewhere I would.
author: Stephanie J.

description: Decent sushi ordered online and delivered everything was packed nicely. Only complaint is that I ordered a bento box which I thought was a normal dinner portion for $11.99 BUT it was a bit portion salmon was sliced thin but dinner portion I had to go get something else to eat!
author: jess c.

description: It's a nice neighborhood place, that excellent for takeout as long as you come down and pick it up yourself. I enjoy the ramen at home on the recent rainy nights. But I enjoy eating sushi here at Dj sushi/Mura. Jenny is excellent always attentive and excellent at making suggestions to fit the occasion or my appetite
author: Anthony L.

description: Love this place since new owners have taken over. The sushi is pretty good. Don't let the outside look fool you. It seems sketch at first but soon as you enter it just looks top notch. I recommend the 49er roll for a refreshing flavor. And they are so quick to make your order wether you are dinning in or placing a to go order.
author: Angel L.

description: Seriously? When you wait over an hour for delivery after requesting extra soy sauce and the food finally shows up with NO SAUCE? messaged Eat24 furious about it. The restaurant called me and started giving me the run around. Terrible customer service ordered once before and was ok with it.. but after today NEVER AGAIN. BTW its been 2 hours and 11 minutes.. and they just brought the sauce.
author: Deah D.

description: Very good, especially the Gyoza. Groupon for two used with no issues at all. Fast service (Tues dinner)
author: t k.

description: Simply the worst delivery sushi I've ever eaten. I can't comment on service. Really, just horrible sushi.
author: Alex B.

description: Pretty good ramen but the sushi was kind of off and not very fresh.  Delivery was fast.
author: Lucks N.

description: I've been here a couple of times, and the staff is very friendly. The food is good too, never had anything that didn't make my stomach happy. Great price and very fresh fish and sea food. I'm glad they're in the hood, since there's not that many Japanese culinary options in the area.
author: Gabriela M.

description: Haven't been here for a while.  Most of the servers were different.  I think they are under new management!!??  The menu is different.  My hubby ordered udon and CA roll, my sister-in-law ordered a sushi plate, and I had chicken teriyaki.  The CA roll came out, then the udon, then the sushi plate.  Hubby and sister-in-law were almost half done and I still haven't received my dinner.  It was obvious I was just sitting there and a server asked me what did I order.  She went to the back and a couple of minutes later came out with my food!  Who knows what happened but they need to time it so that all of the entrees come out the same time!  The food is good...  nothing special but it's satisfying.
author: M. K.

description: This place was awful. Ramen was tasteless; sushi was warm (yeah disgusting I know); delivery was 30min late despite already revising the delivery time 30min later (so pretty much 60min late...). I would not order from here ever again - straight up gross!
author: Frank P.

description: I ordered through eat24 and my order was suppose to be delivered to me by 8:30... My order did not come until 9:10 and I ordered my dinner at 7:45... I even called the restaurant at 8:45 and the lady said oh we just sent the delivery guy out he should be there in 10 min which became 20min later... My order consisted of 2 bowls of ramen, one for me and one for a friend, 2 order of sushi rolls and seaweed salad. Seaweed salad was ok, but the rolls... $4 for one roll each and it was those hand rolls I one seaweed... Not a long one cut into pieces... They weren't that big either... What a rip off... Next up, the ramen... Ok ramen is better fresh and not delivered ok, but the soup didn't even have flavor and I asked for spicy on both and it wasn't even spicy. The noddles tasted like instant noodles and the texture felt like that too. It was all clumped up together even when I poured my soup in it... Bad delivery and estimated time and no flavor in the soup and what a rip off on the sushi
author: Emily S.
